00060 #define EC_EOE_TX_QUEUE_SIZE 100

00064 #define EC_EOE_TRIES 100

00085 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 29)
00086 
00088 static const struct net_device_ops ec_eoedev_ops = {
00089     .ndo_open = ec_eoedev_open,
00090     .ndo_stop = ec_eoedev_stop,
00091     .ndo_start_xmit = ec_eoedev_tx,
00092     .ndo_get_stats = ec_eoedev_stats,
00093 };

00096 /*****************************************************************************/
00097 
00104 int ec_eoe_init(
00105         ec_eoe_t *eoe, 
00106         ec_slave_t *slave 
00107         )
00108 {
00109     ec_eoe_t **priv;
00110     int i, ret = 0;
00111     char name[EC_DATAGRAM_NAME_SIZE];
00112 
00113     eoe->slave = slave;
00114 
00115     ec_datagram_init(&eoe->datagram);
00116     eoe->queue_datagram = 0;
00117     eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_rx_start;
00118     eoe->opened = 0;
00119     eoe->rx_skb = NULL;
00120     eoe->rx_expected_fragment = 0;
00121     INIT_LIST_HEAD(&eoe->tx_queue);
00122     eoe->tx_frame = NULL;
00123     eoe->tx_queue_active = 0;
00124     eoe->tx_queue_size = EC_EOE_TX_QUEUE_SIZE;
00125     eoe->tx_queued_frames = 0;
00126 
00127     sema_init(&eoe->tx_queue_sem, 1);
00128     eoe->tx_frame_number = 0xFF;
00129     memset(&eoe->stats, 0, sizeof(struct net_device_stats));
00130 
00131     eoe->rx_counter = 0;
00132     eoe->tx_counter = 0;
00133     eoe->rx_rate = 0;
00134     eoe->tx_rate = 0;
00135     eoe->rate_jiffies = 0;
00136     eoe->rx_idle = 1;
00137     eoe->tx_idle = 1;
00138 
00139     /* device name eoe<MASTER>[as]<SLAVE>, because networking scripts don't
00140      * like hyphens etc. in interface names. */
00141     if (slave->effective_alias) {
00142         snprintf(name, EC_DATAGRAM_NAME_SIZE,
00143                 "eoe%ua%u", slave->master->index, slave->effective_alias);
00144     } else {
00145         snprintf(name, EC_DATAGRAM_NAME_SIZE,
00146                 "eoe%us%u", slave->master->index, slave->ring_position);
00147     }
00148 
00149     snprintf(eoe->datagram.name, EC_DATAGRAM_NAME_SIZE, name);
00150 
00151     if (!(eoe->dev = alloc_netdev(sizeof(ec_eoe_t *), name, ether_setup))) {
00152         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Unable to allocate net_device %s"
00153                 " for EoE handler!\n", name);
00154         ret = -ENODEV;
00155         goto out_return;
00156     }
00157 
00158     // initialize net_device
00159 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE >= KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 29)
00160     eoe->dev->netdev_ops = &ec_eoedev_ops;
00161 #else
00162     eoe->dev->open = ec_eoedev_open;
00163     eoe->dev->stop = ec_eoedev_stop;
00164     eoe->dev->hard_start_xmit = ec_eoedev_tx;
00165     eoe->dev->get_stats = ec_eoedev_stats;
00166 #endif
00167 
00168     for (i = 0; i < ETH_ALEN; i++)
00169         eoe->dev->dev_addr[i] = i | (i << 4);
00170 
00171     // initialize private data
00172     priv = netdev_priv(eoe->dev);
00173     *priv = eoe;
00174 
00175     // Usually setting the MTU appropriately makes the upper layers
00176     // do the frame fragmenting. In some cases this doesn't work
00177     // so the MTU is left on the Ethernet standard value and fragmenting
00178     // is done "manually".
00179 #if 0
00180     eoe->dev->mtu = slave->configured_rx_mailbox_size - ETH_HLEN - 10;
00181 #endif
00182 
00183     // connect the net_device to the kernel
00184     ret = register_netdev(eoe->dev);
00185     if (ret) {
00186         EC_SLAVE_ERR(slave, "Unable to register net_device:"
00187                 " error %i\n", ret);
00188         goto out_free;
00189     }
00190 
00191     // make the last address octet unique
00192     eoe->dev->dev_addr[ETH_ALEN - 1] = (uint8_t) eoe->dev->ifindex;
00193     return 0;
00194 
00195  out_free:
00196     free_netdev(eoe->dev);
00197     eoe->dev = NULL;
00198  out_return:
00199     return ret;
00200 }
00201 
00202 /*****************************************************************************/
00203 
00208 void ec_eoe_clear(ec_eoe_t *eoe )
00209 {
00210     unregister_netdev(eoe->dev); // possibly calls close callback
00211 
00212     // empty transmit queue
00213     ec_eoe_flush(eoe);
00214 
00215     if (eoe->tx_frame) {
00216         dev_kfree_skb(eoe->tx_frame->skb);
00217         kfree(eoe->tx_frame);
00218     }
00219 
00220     if (eoe->rx_skb)
00221         dev_kfree_skb(eoe->rx_skb);
00222 
00223     free_netdev(eoe->dev);
00224 
00225     ec_datagram_clear(&eoe->datagram);
00226 }
00227 
00228 /*****************************************************************************/
00229 
00232 void ec_eoe_flush(ec_eoe_t *eoe )
00233 {
00234     ec_eoe_frame_t *frame, *next;
00235 
00236     down(&eoe->tx_queue_sem);
00237 
00238     list_for_each_entry_safe(frame, next, &eoe->tx_queue, queue) {
00239         list_del(&frame->queue);
00240         dev_kfree_skb(frame->skb);
00241         kfree(frame);
00242     }
00243     eoe->tx_queued_frames = 0;
00244 
00245     up(&eoe->tx_queue_sem);
00246 }
00247 
00248 /*****************************************************************************/
00249 
00254 int ec_eoe_send(ec_eoe_t *eoe )
00255 {
00256     size_t remaining_size, current_size, complete_offset;
00257     unsigned int last_fragment;
00258     uint8_t *data;
00259 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 3
00260     unsigned int i;
00261 #endif
00262 
00263     remaining_size = eoe->tx_frame->skb->len - eoe->tx_offset;
00264 
00265     if (remaining_size <= eoe->slave->configured_tx_mailbox_size - 10) {
00266         current_size = remaining_size;
00267         last_fragment = 1;
00268     } else {
00269         current_size = ((eoe->slave->configured_tx_mailbox_size - 10) / 32) * 32;
00270         last_fragment = 0;
00271     }
00272 
00273     if (eoe->tx_fragment_number) {
00274         complete_offset = eoe->tx_offset / 32;
00275     }
00276     else {
00277         // complete size in 32 bit blocks, rounded up.
00278         complete_offset = remaining_size / 32 + 1;
00279     }
00280 
00281 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
00282     EC_SLAVE_DBG(slave, 0, "EoE %s TX sending fragment %u%s"
00283             " with %u octets (%u). %u frames queued.\n",
00284             eoe->dev->name, eoe->tx_fragment_number,
00285             last_fragment ? "" : "+", current_size, complete_offset,
00286             eoe->tx_queued_frames);
00287 #endif
00288 
00289 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 3
00290     EC_SLAVE_DBG(master, 0, "");
00291     for (i = 0; i < current_size; i++) {
00292         printk("%02X ", eoe->tx_frame->skb->data[eoe->tx_offset + i]);
00293         if ((i + 1) % 16 == 0) {
00294             printk("\n");
00295             EC_SLAVE_DBG(master, 0, "");
00296         }
00297     }
00298     printk("\n");
00299 #endif
00300 
00301     data = ec_slave_mbox_prepare_send(eoe->slave, &eoe->datagram,
00302             0x02, current_size + 4);
00303     if (IS_ERR(data))
00304         return PTR_ERR(data);
00305 
00306     EC_WRITE_U8 (data,     0x00); // eoe fragment req.
00307     EC_WRITE_U8 (data + 1, last_fragment);
00308     EC_WRITE_U16(data + 2, ((eoe->tx_fragment_number & 0x3F) |
00309                             (complete_offset & 0x3F) << 6 |
00310                             (eoe->tx_frame_number & 0x0F) << 12));
00311 
00312     memcpy(data + 4, eoe->tx_frame->skb->data + eoe->tx_offset, current_size);
00313     eoe->queue_datagram = 1;
00314 
00315     eoe->tx_offset += current_size;
00316     eoe->tx_fragment_number++;
00317     return 0;
00318 }
00319 
00320 /*****************************************************************************/
00321 
00324 void ec_eoe_run(ec_eoe_t *eoe )
00325 {
00326     if (!eoe->opened)
00327         return;
00328 
00329     // if the datagram was not sent, or is not yet received, skip this cycle
00330     if (eoe->queue_datagram || eoe->datagram.state == EC_DATAGRAM_SENT)
00331         return;
00332 
00333     // call state function
00334     eoe->state(eoe);
00335 
00336     // update statistics
00337     if (jiffies - eoe->rate_jiffies > HZ) {
00338         eoe->rx_rate = eoe->rx_counter;
00339         eoe->tx_rate = eoe->tx_counter;
00340         eoe->rx_counter = 0;
00341         eoe->tx_counter = 0;
00342         eoe->rate_jiffies = jiffies;
00343     }
00344 
00345     ec_datagram_output_stats(&eoe->datagram);
00346 }
00347 
00348 /*****************************************************************************/
00349 
00352 void ec_eoe_queue(ec_eoe_t *eoe )
00353 {
00354    if (eoe->queue_datagram) {
00355        ec_master_queue_datagram_ext(eoe->slave->master, &eoe->datagram);
00356        eoe->queue_datagram = 0;
00357    }
00358 }
00359 
00360 /*****************************************************************************/
00361 
00366 int ec_eoe_is_open(const ec_eoe_t *eoe )
00367 {
00368     return eoe->opened;
00369 }
00370 
00371 /*****************************************************************************/
00372 
00378 int ec_eoe_is_idle(const ec_eoe_t *eoe )
00379 {
00380     return eoe->rx_idle && eoe->tx_idle;
00381 }

00383 /******************************************************************************
00384  *  STATE PROCESSING FUNCTIONS
00385  *****************************************************************************/
00386 
00394 void ec_eoe_state_rx_start(ec_eoe_t *eoe )
00395 {
00396     if (eoe->slave->error_flag ||
00397             !eoe->slave->master->devices[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].link_state) {
00398         eoe->rx_idle = 1;
00399         eoe->tx_idle = 1;
00400         return;
00401     }
00402 
00403     ec_slave_mbox_prepare_check(eoe->slave, &eoe->datagram);
00404     eoe->queue_datagram = 1;
00405     eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_rx_check;
00406 }
00407 
00408 /*****************************************************************************/
00409 
00415 void ec_eoe_state_rx_check(ec_eoe_t *eoe )
00416 {
00417     if (eoe->datagram.state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
00418         eoe->stats.rx_errors++;
00419 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 1
00420         EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "Failed to receive mbox"
00421                 " check datagram for %s.\n", eoe->dev->name);
00422 #endif
00423         eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_tx_start;
00424         return;
00425     }
00426 
00427     if (!ec_slave_mbox_check(&eoe->datagram)) {
00428         eoe->rx_idle = 1;
00429         eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_tx_start;
00430         return;
00431     }
00432 
00433     eoe->rx_idle = 0;
00434     ec_slave_mbox_prepare_fetch(eoe->slave, &eoe->datagram);
00435     eoe->queue_datagram = 1;
00436     eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_rx_fetch;
00437 }
00438 
00439 /*****************************************************************************/
00440 
00446 void ec_eoe_state_rx_fetch(ec_eoe_t *eoe )
00447 {
00448     size_t rec_size, data_size;
00449     uint8_t *data, frame_type, last_fragment, time_appended, mbox_prot;
00450     uint8_t fragment_offset, fragment_number;
00451 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
00452     uint8_t frame_number;
00453 #endif
00454     off_t offset;
00455 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 3
00456     unsigned int i;
00457 #endif
00458 
00459     if (eoe->datagram.state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
00460         eoe->stats.rx_errors++;
00461 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 1
00462         EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "Failed to receive mbox"
00463                 " fetch datagram for %s.\n", eoe->dev->name);
00464 #endif
00465         eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_tx_start;
00466         return;
00467     }
00468 
00469     data = ec_slave_mbox_fetch(eoe->slave, &eoe->datagram,
00470             &mbox_prot, &rec_size);
00471     if (IS_ERR(data)) {
00472         eoe->stats.rx_errors++;
00473 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 1
00474         EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "Invalid mailbox response for %s.\n",
00475                 eoe->dev->name);
00476 #endif
00477         eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_tx_start;
00478         return;
00479     }
00480 
00481     if (mbox_prot != 0x02) { // EoE FIXME mailbox handler necessary
00482         eoe->stats.rx_errors++;
00483 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 1
00484         EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "Other mailbox protocol response for %s.\n",
00485                 eoe->dev->name);
00486 #endif
00487         eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_tx_start;
00488         return;
00489     }
00490 
00491     frame_type = EC_READ_U16(data) & 0x000F;
00492 
00493     if (frame_type != 0x00) {
00494 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 1
00495         EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "%s: Other frame received."
00496                 " Dropping.\n", eoe->dev->name);
00497 #endif
00498         eoe->stats.rx_dropped++;
00499         eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_tx_start;
00500         return;
00501     }
00502 
00503     // EoE Fragment Request received
00504 
00505     last_fragment = (EC_READ_U16(data) >> 8) & 0x0001;
00506     time_appended = (EC_READ_U16(data) >> 9) & 0x0001;
00507     fragment_number = EC_READ_U16(data + 2) & 0x003F;
00508     fragment_offset = (EC_READ_U16(data + 2) >> 6) & 0x003F;
00509 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
00510     frame_number = (EC_READ_U16(data + 2) >> 12) & 0x000F;
00511 #endif
00512 
00513 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
00514     EC_SLAVE_DBG(eoe->slave, 0, "EoE %s RX fragment %u%s, offset %u,"
00515             " frame %u%s, %u octets\n", eoe->dev->name, fragment_number,
00516            last_fragment ? "" : "+", fragment_offset, frame_number,
00517            time_appended ? ", + timestamp" : "",
00518            time_appended ? rec_size - 8 : rec_size - 4);
00519 #endif
00520 
00521 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 3
00522     EC_SLAVE_DBG(eoe->slave, 0, "");
00523     for (i = 0; i < rec_size - 4; i++) {
00524         printk("%02X ", data[i + 4]);
00525         if ((i + 1) % 16 == 0) {
00526             printk("\n");
00527             EC_SLAVE_DBG(eoe->slave, 0, "");
00528         }
00529     }
00530     printk("\n");
00531 #endif
00532 
00533     data_size = time_appended ? rec_size - 8 : rec_size - 4;
00534 
00535     if (!fragment_number) {
00536         if (eoe->rx_skb) {
00537             EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "EoE RX freeing old socket buffer.\n");
00538             dev_kfree_skb(eoe->rx_skb);
00539         }
00540 
00541         // new socket buffer
00542         if (!(eoe->rx_skb = dev_alloc_skb(fragment_offset * 32))) {
00543             if (printk_ratelimit())
00544                 EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "EoE RX low on mem,"
00545                         " frame dropped.\n");
00546             eoe->stats.rx_dropped++;
00547             eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_tx_start;
00548             return;
00549         }
00550 
00551         eoe->rx_skb_offset = 0;
00552         eoe->rx_skb_size = fragment_offset * 32;
00553         eoe->rx_expected_fragment = 0;
00554     }
00555     else {
00556         if (!eoe->rx_skb) {
00557             eoe->stats.rx_dropped++;
00558             eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_tx_start;
00559             return;
00560         }
00561 
00562         offset = fragment_offset * 32;
00563         if (offset != eoe->rx_skb_offset ||
00564             offset + data_size > eoe->rx_skb_size ||
00565             fragment_number != eoe->rx_expected_fragment) {
00566             dev_kfree_skb(eoe->rx_skb);
00567             eoe->rx_skb = NULL;
00568             eoe->stats.rx_errors++;
00569 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 1
00570             EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "Fragmenting error at %s.\n",
00571                     eoe->dev->name);
00572 #endif
00573             eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_tx_start;
00574             return;
00575         }
00576     }
00577 
00578     // copy fragment into socket buffer
00579     memcpy(skb_put(eoe->rx_skb, data_size), data + 4, data_size);
00580     eoe->rx_skb_offset += data_size;
00581 
00582     if (last_fragment) {
00583         // update statistics
00584         eoe->stats.rx_packets++;
00585         eoe->stats.rx_bytes += eoe->rx_skb->len;
00586         eoe->rx_counter += eoe->rx_skb->len;
00587 
00588 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
00589         EC_SLAVE_DBG(eoe->slave, 0, "EoE %s RX frame completed"
00590                 " with %u octets.\n", eoe->dev->name, eoe->rx_skb->len);
00591 #endif
00592 
00593         // pass socket buffer to network stack
00594         eoe->rx_skb->dev = eoe->dev;
00595         eoe->rx_skb->protocol = eth_type_trans(eoe->rx_skb, eoe->dev);
00596         eoe->rx_skb->ip_summed = CHECKSUM_UNNECESSARY;
00597         if (netif_rx(eoe->rx_skb)) {
00598             EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "EoE RX netif_rx failed.\n");
00599         }
00600         eoe->rx_skb = NULL;
00601 
00602         eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_tx_start;
00603     }
00604     else {
00605         eoe->rx_expected_fragment++;
00606 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
00607         EC_SLAVE_DBG(eoe->slave, 0, "EoE %s RX expecting fragment %u\n",
00608                eoe->dev->name, eoe->rx_expected_fragment);
00609 #endif
00610         eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_rx_start;
00611     }
00612 }
00613 
00614 /*****************************************************************************/
00615 
00623 void ec_eoe_state_tx_start(ec_eoe_t *eoe )
00624 {
00625 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
00626     unsigned int wakeup = 0;
00627 #endif
00628 
00629     if (eoe->slave->error_flag ||
00630             !eoe->slave->master->devices[EC_DEVICE_MAIN].link_state) {
00631         eoe->rx_idle = 1;
00632         eoe->tx_idle = 1;
00633         return;
00634     }
00635 
00636     down(&eoe->tx_queue_sem);
00637 
00638     if (!eoe->tx_queued_frames || list_empty(&eoe->tx_queue)) {
00639         up(&eoe->tx_queue_sem);
00640         eoe->tx_idle = 1;
00641         // no data available.
00642         // start a new receive immediately.
00643         ec_eoe_state_rx_start(eoe);
00644         return;
00645     }
00646 
00647     // take the first frame out of the queue
00648     eoe->tx_frame = list_entry(eoe->tx_queue.next, ec_eoe_frame_t, queue);
00649     list_del(&eoe->tx_frame->queue);
00650     if (!eoe->tx_queue_active &&
00651         eoe->tx_queued_frames == eoe->tx_queue_size / 2) {
00652         netif_wake_queue(eoe->dev);
00653         eoe->tx_queue_active = 1;
00654 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
00655         wakeup = 1;
00656 #endif
00657     }
00658 
00659     eoe->tx_queued_frames--;
00660     up(&eoe->tx_queue_sem);
00661 
00662     eoe->tx_idle = 0;
00663 
00664     eoe->tx_frame_number++;
00665     eoe->tx_frame_number %= 16;
00666     eoe->tx_fragment_number = 0;
00667     eoe->tx_offset = 0;
00668 
00669     if (ec_eoe_send(eoe)) {
00670         dev_kfree_skb(eoe->tx_frame->skb);
00671         kfree(eoe->tx_frame);
00672         eoe->tx_frame = NULL;
00673         eoe->stats.tx_errors++;
00674         eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_rx_start;
00675 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 1
00676         EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "Send error at %s.\n", eoe->dev->name);
00677 #endif
00678         return;
00679     }
00680 
00681 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
00682     if (wakeup)
00683         EC_SLAVE_DBG(eoe->slave, 0, "EoE %s waking up TX queue...\n",
00684                 eoe->dev->name);
00685 #endif
00686 
00687     eoe->tries = EC_EOE_TRIES;
00688     eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_tx_sent;
00689 }
00690 
00691 /*****************************************************************************/
00692 
00698 void ec_eoe_state_tx_sent(ec_eoe_t *eoe )
00699 {
00700     if (eoe->datagram.state != EC_DATAGRAM_RECEIVED) {
00701         if (eoe->tries) {
00702             eoe->tries--; // try again
00703             eoe->queue_datagram = 1;
00704         } else {
00705             eoe->stats.tx_errors++;
00706 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 1
00707             EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "Failed to receive send"
00708                     " datagram for %s after %u tries.\n",
00709                     eoe->dev->name, EC_EOE_TRIES);
00710 #endif
00711             eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_rx_start;
00712         }
00713         return;
00714     }
00715 
00716     if (eoe->datagram.working_counter != 1) {
00717         if (eoe->tries) {
00718             eoe->tries--; // try again
00719             eoe->queue_datagram = 1;
00720         } else {
00721             eoe->stats.tx_errors++;
00722 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 1
00723             EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "No sending response"
00724                     " for %s after %u tries.\n",
00725                     eoe->dev->name, EC_EOE_TRIES);
00726 #endif
00727             eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_rx_start;
00728         }
00729         return;
00730     }
00731 
00732     // frame completely sent
00733     if (eoe->tx_offset >= eoe->tx_frame->skb->len) {
00734         eoe->stats.tx_packets++;
00735         eoe->stats.tx_bytes += eoe->tx_frame->skb->len;
00736         eoe->tx_counter += eoe->tx_frame->skb->len;
00737         dev_kfree_skb(eoe->tx_frame->skb);
00738         kfree(eoe->tx_frame);
00739         eoe->tx_frame = NULL;
00740         eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_rx_start;
00741     }
00742     else { // send next fragment
00743         if (ec_eoe_send(eoe)) {
00744             dev_kfree_skb(eoe->tx_frame->skb);
00745             kfree(eoe->tx_frame);
00746             eoe->tx_frame = NULL;
00747             eoe->stats.tx_errors++;
00748 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 1
00749             EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "Send error at %s.\n", eoe->dev->name);
00750 #endif
00751             eoe->state = ec_eoe_state_rx_start;
00752         }
00753     }
00754 }
00755 
00756 /******************************************************************************
00757  *  NET_DEVICE functions
00758  *****************************************************************************/
00759 
00764 int ec_eoedev_open(struct net_device *dev )
00765 {
00766     ec_eoe_t *eoe = *((ec_eoe_t **) netdev_priv(dev));
00767     ec_eoe_flush(eoe);
00768     eoe->opened = 1;
00769     eoe->rx_idle = 0;
00770     eoe->tx_idle = 0;
00771     netif_start_queue(dev);
00772     eoe->tx_queue_active = 1;
00773 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
00774     EC_SLAVE_DBG(eoe->slave, 0, "%s opened.\n", dev->name);
00775 #endif
00776     ec_slave_request_state(eoe->slave, EC_SLAVE_STATE_OP);
00777     return 0;
00778 }
00779 
00780 /*****************************************************************************/
00781 
00786 int ec_eoedev_stop(struct net_device *dev )
00787 {
00788     ec_eoe_t *eoe = *((ec_eoe_t **) netdev_priv(dev));
00789     netif_stop_queue(dev);
00790     eoe->rx_idle = 1;
00791     eoe->tx_idle = 1;
00792     eoe->tx_queue_active = 0;
00793     eoe->opened = 0;
00794     ec_eoe_flush(eoe);
00795 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
00796     EC_SLAVE_DBG(eoe->slave, 0, "%s stopped.\n", dev->name);
00797 #endif
00798     ec_slave_request_state(eoe->slave, EC_SLAVE_STATE_PREOP);
00799     return 0;
00800 }
00801 
00802 /*****************************************************************************/
00803 
00808 int ec_eoedev_tx(struct sk_buff *skb, 
00809                  struct net_device *dev 
00810                 )
00811 {
00812     ec_eoe_t *eoe = *((ec_eoe_t **) netdev_priv(dev));
00813     ec_eoe_frame_t *frame;
00814 
00815 #if 0
00816     if (skb->len > eoe->slave->configured_tx_mailbox_size - 10) {
00817         EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "EoE TX frame (%u octets)"
00818                 " exceeds MTU. dropping.\n", skb->len);
00819         dev_kfree_skb(skb);
00820         eoe->stats.tx_dropped++;
00821         return 0;
00822     }
00823 #endif
00824 
00825     if (!(frame =
00826           (ec_eoe_frame_t *) kmalloc(sizeof(ec_eoe_frame_t), GFP_ATOMIC))) {
00827         if (printk_ratelimit())
00828             EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "EoE TX: low on mem. frame dropped.\n");
00829         return 1;
00830     }
00831 
00832     frame->skb = skb;
00833 
00834     down(&eoe->tx_queue_sem);
00835     list_add_tail(&frame->queue, &eoe->tx_queue);
00836     eoe->tx_queued_frames++;
00837     if (eoe->tx_queued_frames == eoe->tx_queue_size) {
00838         netif_stop_queue(dev);
00839         eoe->tx_queue_active = 0;
00840     }
00841     up(&eoe->tx_queue_sem);
00842 
00843 #if EOE_DEBUG_LEVEL >= 2
00844     EC_SLAVE_DBG(eoe->slave, 0, "EoE %s TX queued frame"
00845             " with %u octets (%u frames queued).\n",
00846             eoe->dev->name, skb->len, eoe->tx_queued_frames);
00847     if (!eoe->tx_queue_active)
00848         EC_SLAVE_WARN(eoe->slave, "EoE TX queue is now full.\n");
00849 #endif
00850 
00851     return 0;
00852 }
00853 
00854 /*****************************************************************************/
00855 
00860 struct net_device_stats *ec_eoedev_stats(
00861         struct net_device *dev 
00862         )
00863 {
00864     ec_eoe_t *eoe = *((ec_eoe_t **) netdev_priv(dev));
00865     return &eoe->stats;
00866 }
